OIIX A3627/25.explanation: A crucial navigation system called 'ANK VOR' in the Iran airspace is currently broken and cannot be used by aircraft. It will be out of service from December 2, 2025, until at least March 2, 2026. After it's fixed, it will need to be tested by a special aircraft before it can be used again.

OIIX A3707/25.explanation: From December 10, 2025, until March 10, 2026, a specific air route named N39, located in the Tehran (Iran) airspace between DEMBA and OBRIX, will be closed to all aircraft. Pilots flying through this area will need to use alternative routes. For flights heading west, they must fly via RADAL, IMKER, and ULDUS, maintaining an altitude of at least 27,500 feet. For flights heading east, they must fly via ULDUS, ALKUP, IMLIM, OXADU, and then M715 to OBRIX, maintaining an altitude of at least 28,500 feet.

OIIX A3708/25.explanation: This is a notice for pilots flying in the airspace around Tehran, Iran. It announces that two specific aerial 'highways' (called airways G208 and L125) are closed between two navigation points, RADAL and IKA (Imam Khomeini International Airport's navigation beacon). This closure is in effect from December 10, 2025, to March 10, 2026. Pilots who normally use these closed airways must now fly a different route, specifically by going directly from a point called ROVAD to IKA airport. The RADAL navigation point itself is still available for flights arriving at Tehran Mehrabad, Isfahan, and Shiraz airports.

OIIX A3714/25.explanation: This notice tells foreign airlines and aircraft that when they fly into, out of, or through Iranian airspace, they need to send their flight plans and any updates to a specific address (OIIXIFPS). They also must follow the flight procedures detailed in Iran's official aviation guide (AIP ENR 1.11). It's a change in how flight plans are submitted and managed, not a closure or a safety warning.

OIIX A3715/25.explanation: This is an official notice for pilots flying in the Tehran region. It states that several specific High Frequency (HF) radio channels, which are used for communication with air traffic control and information services, are currently not working. This issue is temporary, starting in December 2025 and expected to last until March 2026. Pilots will need to use alternative communication frequencies or methods during this period.

OIIX A3716/25.explanation: A new controlled zone has been created for aircraft in the skies south of Tehran, Iran. This zone starts at about 19,500 feet high and goes upwards without limit. For airplanes flying at 20,000 feet, it's a specific type of controlled airspace (Class D), and higher than that, it's an even more strictly controlled type (Class A). This means pilots flying through this area must follow instructions from Tehran Air Traffic Control on radio frequency 133.400 MHz. This new setup is in effect from December 11, 2025, to March 11, 2026, and is active all day, every day.

OIIX A3717/25.explanation: This is an official notice for pilots flying in the airspace over Tehran, Iran. It announces a change to the radio frequencies used to communicate with air traffic control. Several existing frequencies for different sectors of the airspace are being replaced or consolidated into a new single frequency: 258.400 MHz. This change will be in effect from December 11, 2025, until March 11, 2026. Pilots must use the new frequency to ensure proper communication.

OIIX A3718/25.explanation: This is an official notice for pilots about several air routes in the Tehran flight region. It states that these routes (identified by names like R659, G666, etc.) are now also open for use by aircraft that have a specific modern navigation system called RNAV5. This means planes with this system can use these routes from their lowest safe flying height. This change will be in effect from December 2025 to March 2026.

OIIX A3810/25.explanation: Attention pilots flying through the Tehran airspace in Iran! A crucial radar system known as 'Kushk MSSR' is out of service. This means air traffic controllers will not have radar tracking information for aircraft in certain parts of that airspace, specifically in areas called Sector 1, Sector 2, and Sector 7. This problem is expected to last from December 16, 2025, until March 16, 2026. Pilots should be aware that radar services may not be available in these areas.

OIIX B0995/25.explanation: This is an official aviation notice (NOTAM) for flights in Iran, specifically affecting domestic routes between Tehran Imam Khomeini Airport and Mashhad Airport. Starting from December 28, 2025, and lasting until March 28, 2026, all domestic flights between these two airports must follow one of two new, mandatory flight paths. This is a new system to manage air traffic more effectively.

OIIX A0064/26.explanation: This is an official notice for pilots flying in the airspace around Tehran, Iran. It announces that a specific area, identified as 'OID125', will be restricted from flying through. This restriction will be active daily from early morning to late afternoon, starting on January 5, 2026, and continuing until March 19, 2026. The no-fly zone extends from the ground up to 18,000 feet above sea level. All pilots, regardless of their flight type, must avoid this area when it's active.

OIIX A0066/26.explanation: A specific area in the Tehran region, identified as OID127, is now restricted for aircraft. This means planes cannot fly through this area. The restriction is in effect daily from January 5, 2026, to March 20, 2026, between 03:30 AM and 07:30 PM UTC. The restricted zone extends from the ground up to 12,000 feet above sea level.

OIIX A0070/26.explanation: From January 5 to March 19, 2026, a specific area designated OID122 in the OIIX flight region will become a restricted or danger zone. During these dates, daily from 2:30 AM to 8:30 PM UTC, no aircraft will be allowed to fly in this area from the ground up to 16,000 feet above sea level. This restriction affects all types of flights and is in effect for operational reasons.

OIIX A0072/26.explanation: For pilots and aircraft, a specific area in Iran, known as OID123, is now a restricted zone. This means aircraft are not permitted to fly within this area from the ground up to 18,000 feet. This restriction is active daily during specific hours, starting January 5, 2026, and lasting until March 19, 2026.

OIIX A0065/26.explanation: Between January 8 and March 19, 2026, military gun firing exercises will happen in a specific area of Iran. These exercises will take place every Saturday and Thursday from 11:30 AM to 2:30 PM UTC. The affected airspace stretches from the ground up to 18,000 feet above sea level. Pilots and aircraft operators need to be aware of this activity and avoid the designated area during these times for safety.

OIIX A0080/26.explanation: From January 8 to March 19, 2026, on Saturdays and Thursdays between 11:30 AM and 2:30 PM UTC, planes flying on specific air routes (M434 and Z740) in the Tehran area, specifically between points ASLAX and NOLTO, must fly at or above 19,000 feet. This is a higher minimum altitude than usual for safety reasons, meaning planes cannot fly below this level during those times.

OIIX B0031/26.explanation: Attention pilots and air travelers: A specific danger area, identified as OID124, in the Tehran region will be active daily from 3:30 AM to 6:30 PM UTC, starting January 12, 2026, and lasting until March 19, 2026. During these times, aircraft are restricted from flying in this area from the ground up to 13,000 feet above sea level. This means flights might need to be rerouted or avoid this specific zone.

OIIX A0198/26.explanation: This notice is an update for air traffic rules in the airspace over Iran. It details changes to specific domestic flight paths (how planes are routed for takeoff and landing) for particular routes, such as flights between Kermanshah and Mashhad, and between Shiraz and Bandar Abbas, Kish Island, or Kerman. These adjustments are part of a broader plan to manage air traffic more efficiently and will be in effect from January 12th to April 12th, 2026.

OIIX B0038/26.explanation: Heads up for anyone flying in the Mashhad region of Iran! From January 13, 2026, to March 19, 2026, there will be daily gun firing exercises between 03:30 and 18:30 UTC. This activity will occur in a specific defined area, reaching from the ground up to 14,000 feet above sea level. Pilots should be aware of this military live firing.

OIIX A0205/26.explanation: There's a warning about military gun firing exercises happening in a specific area near Sistan & Baluchestan. These exercises will take place every day from January 13, 2026, to March 19, 2026, between 3:30 AM and 7:30 PM (UTC). The shooting will happen from the ground up to 20,000 feet in the sky. It's unsafe for any aircraft to fly through this zone during these hours.

OIIX B0039/26.explanation: There will be gun firing in a specific area. This will happen daily from 03:30 AM to 06:30 PM UTC, starting on January 13, 2026, and ending on March 19, 2026. Aircraft should avoid this area from the ground up to 13,000 feet above sea level.

OIIX A0206/26.explanation: An area in the sky, called OID130, near Tehran is now restricted for aircraft. This means planes cannot fly through it from the ground up to 13,000 feet during specific hours (05:30 to 11:30 UTC) every day, starting January 13, 2026, and ending March 19, 2026. Pilots must avoid this area during these times.

OIIX B0040/26.explanation: This is an aviation alert for pilots about military gun firing exercises. These exercises will take place in a specific area within Iran (Tehran Flight Information Region), defined by the provided coordinates. They are scheduled daily from January 13, 2026, until March 19, 2026, specifically between 3:30 AM and 6:30 PM Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). The affected airspace extends from the ground up to 15,000 feet above sea level, and all types of aircraft are advised to be aware of this potential hazard.

OIIX A0207/26.explanation: This is an aviation alert for pilots about ongoing gun firing exercises. From January 13 to March 19, 2026, daily between 3:30 AM and 8:30 PM UTC, there will be gun firing within a specific geographic area. This activity will affect airspace from the ground up to 20,000 feet above sea level. This alert replaces an earlier one about similar activities.

OIIX A0208/26.explanation: An area called OID128 in the Tehran region is now a restricted zone for aircraft. This means planes cannot fly there from the ground up to 15,000 feet. This restriction is in effect daily from January 13 to March 19, 2026, between 2:30 AM and 4:30 PM UTC. Pilots should check their maps for details.

OIIX B0041/26.explanation: This is an official alert for pilots and air traffic controllers about military gun firing exercises taking place in a specific area of Iran. These exercises will happen daily from January 13 to March 19, 2026, between 03:30 AM and 06:30 PM Universal Coordinated Time. The dangerous area for aircraft extends from the ground up to 11,000 feet above sea level. Pilots flying in this region must be aware of this activity.

OIIX A0229/26.explanation: An area called OID121 in the Tehran region will be restricted for all aircraft from January 15 to March 19, 2026. This restriction will be active daily between 03:30 AM and 07:30 PM UTC, from the ground up to 30,000 feet. Pilots must avoid this specific area during these times.

OIIX B0062/26.explanation: From January 25 to April 25, 2026, most private and recreational flights (VFR and General Aviation) are suspended across a large area of Iran. Only essential flights like those operating very close to airports, emergency services (hospital, search and rescue), government, military, and specific National Iranian Oil Co. helicopter flights are allowed, but even these require prior approval from air traffic control.

OIIX B0068/26.explanation: This is a warning for pilots that live gun firing will be happening in a specific area. The area is a circle with a 4-nautical mile radius centered near 35°41' North latitude and 61°10' East longitude. This activity will occur daily from January 26, 2026, until February 25, 2026, between the hours of 03:30 AM and 01:30 PM UTC. The gun firing will affect airspace from the ground up to 9,500 feet above sea level, so pilots should avoid this region during these times.

OIIX B0065/26.explanation: There will be daily gun firing exercises from January 26th to February 25th, 2026. These exercises will take place between 4:30 AM and 10:30 AM UTC each day. The affected area is a circle with a 3-nautical-mile radius (about 5.5 kilometers) centered near 35 degrees 54 minutes North, 47 degrees 02 minutes East. The dangerous zone extends from the ground up to 11,000 feet above sea level. Pilots are strongly advised to avoid this specific region during these times.

OIIX B0067/26.explanation: There will be gun firing in a specific area, a circle with a 3-nautical-mile radius, centered near 35 degrees 18 minutes North, 46 degrees 22 minutes East. This activity will occur daily from January 26, 2026, to February 25, 2026, between 04:30 AM and 10:30 AM UTC. The affected airspace is from the ground up to 10,000 feet above sea level. Pilots and aircraft should be aware of this dangerous activity.

OIIX B0069/26.explanation: Attention all pilots and aircraft! From January 26, 2026, to February 25, 2026, there will be gun firing exercises daily between 04:30 AM and 10:30 AM UTC. This activity will take place in a circular area with a 1 nautical mile radius, centered at coordinates 36°46'59.3"N, 46°56'06.7"E. The danger extends from the ground up to 10,500 feet above sea level. Aircraft should avoid this specific area during these times for safety.

OIIX B0070/26.explanation: This is a warning for pilots about gun firing activities in a specific area of Iran. The gun firing will occur daily between 4:30 AM and 10:30 AM UTC, starting from January 26, 2026, and ending on February 25, 2026. The danger zone is a circle with a 1 nautical mile radius around the coordinates 35°18'37.8"N 046°22'05.5"E, from ground level up to 10,500 feet above sea level. Aircraft should be aware of this hazard during the specified times.

OIIX B0081/26.explanation: There will be gun firing exercises in a specific area of Iran. This activity will occur daily between 3:30 AM and 6:30 PM UTC, starting on January 27th and ending on March 19th, 2026. The gun firing will take place from the ground up to 14,000 feet above sea level within a defined set of coordinates. This serves as a warning for aircraft operating in the vicinity during these times.

OIIX A0367/26.explanation: From January 27th to March 20th, 2026, a specific area of the sky near Tehran will be restricted for aircraft. This restriction will be active every day during this period, from 3:30 AM to 7:30 PM UTC. No planes are allowed to fly in this area, from the ground up to 11,500 feet high. This is likely for safety or security reasons, and pilots have been informed to avoid the area.

OIIX A0386/26.explanation: An area in the Tehran region (Iran), known as OID84, will be restricted for all types of flights. This restriction is in effect daily from January 31, 2026, until March 19, 2026, specifically between 03:30 AM and 07:30 PM UTC each day. The restricted airspace covers the area from the ground up to 13,000 feet above sea level. Pilots need to consult official aviation documents for detailed information about this restricted area.

OIIX B0072/26.explanation: This is a warning for aircraft about live gun firing taking place in a specific area in Iran. The danger zone is a circle with a 7-nautical-mile radius (about 8 miles) centered near 31° North, 59° East. The firing will happen from the ground up to 11,000 feet above sea level. It will occur daily between 3:30 AM and 3:30 PM UTC, starting February 9th and ending February 23rd, 2026. Aircraft should avoid this area during these times due to the hazardous activity.

OIIX B0090/26.explanation: There will be gun firing exercises in a specific circular area, 4 nautical miles in radius, located around 31 degrees 28 minutes North, 60 degrees 47 minutes East. This will happen daily from February 9, 2026, to March 11, 2026, between 3:30 AM and 8:30 PM Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). All aircraft, regardless of flight rules, should be aware of this danger from ground level up to 9,500 feet above sea level.

OIIX B0091/26.explanation: This is a warning for pilots about gun firing exercises taking place in a specific area of Iran. The danger zone is a circle with a 3 nautical mile radius around the coordinates 33°20'58"N 060°44'09"E. This activity will occur daily from 03:30 UTC to 20:30 UTC, starting on February 9, 2026, and concluding on March 11, 2026. The gun firing will affect altitudes from the ground up to 9,000 feet above sea level, meaning aircraft should avoid this area during the specified times.

OIIX B0092/26.explanation: Attention all pilots and air travelers: There will be gun firing exercises taking place in a specific area in Iran, centered around the coordinates 33°43'54"N 60°32'23"E. This activity will occur daily from February 9, 2026, to March 11, 2026, between 3:30 AM and 8:30 PM UTC. The affected zone is a circular area with a 2-nautical-mile radius, from the ground up to 11,000 feet above sea level. Aircraft should be aware of this military activity during these times.

OIIX B0093/26.explanation: From February 9th to March 11th, 2026, there will be daily gun firing exercises in a specific area of Iran, near Sistan & Baluchestan. These exercises will happen every day between 3:30 AM and 8:30 PM UTC. The affected zone is a circular area about 4 miles wide, from the ground up to 10,500 feet in the air. Pilots and anyone flying in this region should be aware of this military activity.

OIIX B0095/26.explanation: Starting February 9th, 2026, and lasting until March 1st, 2026, there will be military gun firing exercises near Mashhad, Iran. These exercises will occur daily between 3:30 AM and 10:30 AM UTC. The danger zone is a circular area, about 3 nautical miles (5.5 kilometers) wide, extending from the ground up to 10,000 feet (about 3 kilometers) in the air. Aircraft should be aware of this active firing zone.

OIIX B0102/26.explanation: Attention pilots and air travelers! From February 9, 2026, to March 11, 2026, there will be gun firing exercises daily between 3:30 AM and 8:30 PM UTC. These activities will take place in a circular area with a 4-nautical-mile radius, centered near 32 degrees 23 minutes North, 60 degrees 50 minutes East (in Iran). The firing will occur from the ground up to 9,000 feet above sea level. Aircraft should avoid this specific area during these times for safety.

OIIX B0106/26.explanation: A military gun firing exercise will take place in a specific area within the Tehran airspace (FIR) on February 18, 19, 22, and 23, 2026. On these dates, the firing will occur between 04:30 AM and 08:30 PM UTC. Aircraft should be aware that gun firing will happen from the ground up to 8,000 feet above sea level, affecting all types of flights.

OIIX B0132/26.explanation: This is an official aviation message (NOTAM) that acts like a checklist or table of contents for important aviation documents. It tells pilots and aviation personnel which versions of the official aviation publications (like rulebooks, maps, and temporary advisories) are currently valid and up-to-date. It also notes that no new major updates will be published on March 19, 2026. Essentially, it's a reminder to ensure everyone is using the correct and latest information for flying in the Tehran Flight Information Region.

OIIX A0614/26.explanation: This is an administrative notice for pilots flying in or through the Tehran (Iran) airspace. It acts as a checklist, listing all the currently active aviation notices (NOTAMs), official publications (AIP Amendments and Supplements), and circulars (AICs) that pilots need to review to ensure they have the most up-to-date information for safe operations. It also informs that no new major aviation information update will be published on March 19, 2026.

OIIX A0249/26.explanation: This is an official announcement for pilots and airlines about a major update to the aviation rulebook, called the Aeronautical Information Publication (AIP). Starting February 19, 2026, a new version of the rulebook will be in effect. It includes many changes to general aviation information, flight routes, and specific details for numerous airports. These changes cover things like new maps, updated flight procedures (take-offs, landings, approaches), communication frequencies, runway characteristics, lighting, and navigation aids. Pilots and operators must ensure they have the updated information by the effective date.

OIIX A0516/26.explanation: Attention pilots in the Tehran region! A specific danger or restricted area, identified as OID126, is now active daily from February 19 to March 19, 2026, between 3:30 AM and 4:30 PM UTC. This affects all types of flights and extends from the ground up to 14,000 feet above sea level. Pilots must refer to their aeronautical charts for detailed information on this activated zone.

OIIX A0589/26.explanation: Danger Warning: Military gun firing exercises will take place in a specific area of Iran. These exercises are scheduled for Wednesdays, between February 25 and March 18, 2026, from 3:30 AM to 6:30 AM Universal Time. The affected airspace is from the ground up to 12,000 feet. Aircraft should avoid this area during these times.

OIIX A0357/26.explanation: This is an official notice for pilots and airlines. It states that there will be no new updates or changes to the standard aviation information publications (like maps and procedures) on March 19, 2026, for the Tehran flight information region. Essentially, it's a heads-up that nothing new will be published on that specific date.

OIIX B0137/26.explanation: This is a warning for pilots about gun firing exercises taking place in a specific area in Iran. The exercises will happen daily between 02:30 AM and 02:30 PM UTC, from February 24th to March 2nd, 2026. The danger zone is a circle with a 3 nautical mile radius, extending from the ground up to 8,000 feet above sea level. Pilots should be aware of this activity.
